review: "Legion of Super-Heroes Archives, Vol. 11" offers a mix of high-quality art and uneven writing. Mike Grell's illustrations are a standout, bringing the futuristic setting to life with dynamic and detailed panels. However, the initial writing by Cary Bates is somewhat lackluster, with some characters feeling absurd or underdeveloped. The narrative improves significantly when Jim Shooter takes over, adding more depth and maturity. While this volume doesn't fully meet my high standards for engaging plots and character development, it still provides a solid read for fans of superhero comics, especially those interested in the evolution of the Legion."
